intro: Euthrixia, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants in the Solanaceae family. These plants are characterized by their hairy, often silver- or gray-green leaves, which give them their common name. Euthrixia species typically produce small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale blue in color. They are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in dry, rocky habitats. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value or have historical uses in traditional medicine.
